history.content: As far as I know, the default option is to defer the units to fall. You can try asking the CS 375 instructor (Victor, vhuang@eecs.berkeley.edu) about this.

children.subject: I’m also experiencing a similar situation, can you update the thread if you hear anything?
I believe you can have the units count in the Summer, but as Peyrin said: the default is to defer to the fall, and emailing Victor is your best bet
I was wondering if there have been any updates to this issue? Summer sessions have started to begin so any update would be lovely.

history.content:
So I'm going to be a U/GSI for the first time this summer, and the addendum says that I have to enroll in CS 370 or EE/CS 375 for the summer. I can't find the courses anywhere, so I was wondering how is it going to work?

I will be taking a 4-unit technical course alongside my U/GSI position, but I signed up for an asynchronous writing session to get the 6 units I need to get financial aid. However, since EE/CS 375 are two units and CS 370 is 3 units, if I'm going to be taking one of these alongside my U/GSI position, does that mean that I will potentially have 8-9 units in the summer (4 units technical + 2 units writing + 2 units EE/CS 375 OR 3 units CS 370)? Should I drop the extra 2 unit course I'm taking then if that is the case? (since taking CS 370 or EE/CS 375 over the summer will make my summer unit total at 6-7 units)

I also heard that the units may transfer to the Fall semester instead so that you don't have to pay for them over the summer. If that is the rule of thumb, could I ask for the units to be included in my summer unit total, since I will be taking courses and paying for them anyways?

Thanks !
history.subject: CS 370 / EE/CS 375 Sum '22
